definitions.definition: a piece of cloth or other material used to mend or strengthen a torn or weak point.
a pad or shield worn over a sightless or injured eye or an eye socket.
examples: cover, eye patch, covering, pad a patch over one eye

definitions.definition: a piece of cloth sewn onto clothing as a badge or distinguishing mark.
a small piece of code inserted into a program to improve its functioning or to correct an error.
an adhesive piece of drug-impregnated material worn on the skin so that the drug can be absorbed gradually over a period of time.
a part of something marked out from the rest by a particular characteristic.
examples: his hair was combed forward to hide a growing bald patch
synonyms: blemish; informalsplotch "a reddish patch on her wrist"

definitions.definition: a small area or amount of something.
examples: patches of bluebells in the grass

definitions.definition: a small disk of black silk attached to the face, especially as worn by women in the 17th and 18th centuries for adornment.
a small piece of ground, especially one used for gardening.
examples: they spent Sundays digging their vegetable patch

definitions.definition: an area for which someone is responsible or in which they operate.
examples: we didn't want any secret organizations on our patch

definitions.definition: a period of time seen as a distinct unit with a characteristic quality.
examples: he may have been going through a bad patch
synonyms: stretch "they are going through a difficult patch"

definitions.definition: a temporary electrical or telephone connection.
a preset configuration or sound-data file in an electronic musical instrument, especially a synthesizer.
mend or strengthen (fabric or an item of clothing) by putting a piece of material over a hole or weak point in it.
place a patch over (a good eye) in order to encourage a lazy eye to work.
correct, enhance, or modify (a routine or program) by inserting a patch.
cover small areas of (a surface) with something different, causing it to appear variegated.
examples: the grass was patched with sandy stretches

definitions.definition: treat someone's injuries or repair the damage to something, especially hastily.
examples: they did their best to patch up the gaping wounds
synonyms: do a makeshift repair on "the houses were being patched up"

definitions.definition: construct something hastily from unsuitable components.
examples: lean-tos patched together from aluminum siding and planks

definitions.definition: restore peaceful or friendly relations after a quarrel or dispute.
examples: any ill feeling could be patched up with a phone call
synonyms: square "he's trying to patch things up with his wife"

definitions.definition: connect by a temporary electrical, radio, or telephonic connection.
examples: Ralph had patched her through to the meeting by walkie-talkie
